titleStmt.title: The second humble cry of this kingdome to their desired nursing father the king with Parliament for their preventing helpe against the power of sword and famine with the meanes thereof propounded in this city and all places yet unplundered, and if the noyse of the multitude of businesse doe kepe them from hearing us, we entreat our elder brethren in London and Westminster dayly to present this our supplycation to their eyes and eares.
titleStmt.author: Nutt, Thomas, 17th cent.

notesStmt.note: Proposes measures to conserve supply of grain and blames swearing for the troubles of the land--MH-H.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
